articles.author: By Maureen O'Hare, CNN
articles.title: Qantas plans for London-Sydney nonstop flights suspended by coronavirus
articles.description: Australian airline Qantas has suspended plans for the world's longest commercial airline passenger flight -- a nonstop service from London to Sydney -- citing Covid-19 as a setback
articles.content:
Sydney (CNN) At a time when traveling more than two kilometers is a pipe dream beyond the reach of millions, it's not surprising the mood isn't right to press on with plans for a 19-hour nonstop flight service between London and Sydney.

articles.description: Cinco de Mayo falls on #tacotuesday this year. Cookbook author and TV host Pati Jinich shares some history and Mexican cooking tips for a buena at-home fiesta.
articles.content:
(CNN) Every year, every story about Cinco de Mayo is required to point out that no, this is not Mexico's Independence Day (that's September 16).

articles.author: Ariane de Vogue, CNN Supreme Court Reporter
articles.title: How to listen to Tuesday's Supreme Court oral arguments
articles.description: The Supreme Court is continuing to hold oral arguments via teleconference due to the coronavirus pandemic. And in a historic first, it's also allowing oral arguments to be aired live to the public.

articles.title: Italians reunited with pizza as lockdown eases
articles.description: The pizzerias of Naples, Italy, are back in business now that Italy has eased its lockdown. It's a small step back to normality for this city's residents. CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

articles.title: Venezuela claims to have captured two Americans involved in failed invasion
articles.description: Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro says two American "mercenaries" have been apprehended after a failed coup attempt launched over the weekend.

articles.title: Covid-19 could spell economic disaster for idyllic Spanish island
articles.description: Spain's Formentera island is being allowed to reopen a week ahead of the rest of the country. But while it managed to largely avoid Covid-19, Formentera's tourism-based economy will struggle. CNN's Scott McLean reports.

articles.author: Breeze Barrington, CNN
articles.title: Dutch Master Vermeer's guide to counting the hours
articles.description: In the 17th-century, the artist produced numerous works while shielding himself indoors from the plague-ridden streets of Delft. His paintings of women and their lives at home feel increasingly relevant in light of coronavirus lockdowns around the world.
articles.content:
arts
The Dutch painter Jan Vermeer was no stranger to the kind of socially isolated world we now find ourselves in. His hometown of Delft was stricken with plague several times in the artist's lifetime. In 1635 and 1636 over 2,000 people died, and in the mid… [+3780 chars]

articles.title: 15 children are hospitalized in New York City with an inflammatory syndrome that could be linked to coronavirus
articles.description: Fifteen children in New York City have been hospitalized with symptoms compatible with a multi-system inflammatory syndrome possibly linked to coronavirus, according to a health alert issued by the New York City Health Department on Monday.

articles.title: New Orleans could be facing a $170 million shortfall because of coronavirus
articles.description: The city of New Orleans is facing a huge budget shortfall following economic losses blamed on the coronavirus pandemic, Mayor LaToya Cantrell said in a news conference Monday.
